metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9114 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
There is a NULL Pointer Access in function imagetopnm of convert.c:1943(jp2) of OpenJPEG 2.1.2. image->comps[compno].data is not assigned a value after initialization(NULL). Impact is Denial of Service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9114` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.2.0-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> According to comments in issue 863 (related to CVE-2016-9572), https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/issues/863#issuecomment-258071962 to be more specific, and the changes in commit 2fa0fc61f2d, which fixes 862, it seems like this issue might be fixed by commit 2fa0fc61f2d (this commit, however, seems to be incomplete, and this is fixed by additionally adding 784d4d47e97). eslerm> in addition to 2fa0fc6 and 784d4d4, c22cbd8 and 00f4568 was applied to this set of CVEs note that 00f4568 is part of 0394f8d

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-1').
